cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwestward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf coast (Texas–Louisiana border area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect yet (watches expected later for north-west Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-western Gulf Coast from central Texas through western Louisiana
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely but possible if rain bands shift west
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft surge cannot be ruled out)
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained tropical-storm-force winds or gusts (39–50 mph) late Wednesday into early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge possible in Matagorda Bay and Lavaca Bay if the storm track shifts west
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain bands could bring 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts if the core passes closer
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous rip currents in approaches; possible port access restrictions beginning late Wednesday
